alert.note: Alert for Coastal Ocean; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 23 at 8:47PM EST until December 24 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level in low- lying areas. * WHERE...Ocean and Coastal Ocean. * WHEN...Until midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Water levels have dropped below flood stage across the oceanfront and inlets. As a result, the coastal flood warnings have been allowed to expire for these areas. The exception is Barnegat Bay. Because of the onshore flow we saw ahead of the Arctic cold front earlier today, the bay is still draining slowly. As a result, up to one foot of inundation above ground level can still be expected across low-lying areas as we move through the evening.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
